Package javax.jaxtx.exceptions

Exception Summary
InvalidParentException The parent transaction was invalid in the scope it was intended to be used.
InvalidParticipantException The participant reference was invalid.
InvalidSecurityOptionException The invoker does not have sufficient access rights to attempt the operation.
InvalidTimeoutException Thrown if the timeout value associated with the invoking thread which should be applied to newly created transactions is invalid.
InvalidTransactionException Thrown if an attempt is made to utilise an unknown transaction.
JAXTXException This is the base class from which all JAXTX related exceptions inherit.
NestingNotAllowedException Not all transaction models allow nesting of transactions to occur.
NoPermissionException The invoking thread does not have permission to attempt to use the operation.
NoSuchServiceException Thrown if a request for a specific transaction implementation cannot be met.
NoTransactionException Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread and one needs to be in order to execute the operation.
ProtocolViolationException Thrown if the underlying protocol is violated in some way during termination.
SystemException Thrown if an error occurs which is not met by another specific exception.
UnknownParticipantException Thrown if an attempt is made to delist a participant that the coordinator has no knowledge about.
WrongStateException Thrown if the state of the transaction is such that it disallows the attempted operation.
